oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bowman Chapel United Methodist: front elevation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of Bowman Chapel. The Gothic-influence building features an asymmetrical double-gable roof and gable-fronted vestibule with modern double doors. The steeple juts from the ridge of the roof. A tower with a shed roof is located on the right of the building. The facade contains brick veneer in the gable area. Brick veneer also covers the top portion of the tower. The building is constructed of bricks painted white.

Bowman Chapel United Methodist is rural African American church in Dickson, Tennessee. The current building shows Gothic influences and dates to 1920. At time of fieldwork, the building was believed to be eligible for the National Register. Reverend Ken Murray served as pastor at that time.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
